intro: Ancistrocladus pachyrrhachis, commonly known as the thick-stemmed ancistrocladus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Ancistrocladaceae and is characterized by its woody, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and the plant is often found in humid, forested environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
